result.execSummary:
Lavonna A Johnson was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Lavonna A Johnson was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lavonna A Johnson

records.addlTxt: Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont appeared by video for Lavonna A Johnson.  Attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has been turned over to the State of TENNESSEE on 08.23.2022.  On motion of the state, Court ordered case closed.
Received and Filed: Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs

Defendant Lavonna A Johnson in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs. Defendant Lavonna A Johnson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lavonna A Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.  Court reviewed Criminal Complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus. Court found the Defendant is the person wanted in the State of Tennessee. Defendant WAIVED Extradition and signed Waiver. Court ordered the Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Affidavit of Complaint from State of Tennessee, County of Sumner
